website_summaries.verdict: A non-irritating product that is moisturizing and healing.
pros: Users give this butter top marks for how soothing and moisturizing it is
Earns high praise for how well it helps with chafing, cracking, and even blisters
It also stands out for going on smoothly like a balm instead of being stiff or sticky
cons: Some women found that the product became slightly grainy when exposed to fluctuating temperatures

customer_reviews.title: I ordered Organic Nipple Butter and received the Natural Nipple Butter while similar it’s not what I ordered!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Earth Mama Organic Nipple butter and received 2 of the older Verision Natural Nipple Butter. I have severe Eczema on my nipples and am trying so hard to get through the last month of breastfeeding my baby girl until she’s 1. I ordered the organic as that’s what I’ve been using, it’s approved by my dermatologist and I know I won’t have a reaction. While I know it is mostly the same I’m very disappointed that I ordered one thing and received something else. After all the pain and issues I’ve been through I’m afraid to even use this because I don’t want any of the ingredients to make my reaction worse.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Czechowski

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a necessity for a breastfeeding mom!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff made SUCH a difference in breastfeeding for me! I breastfed my first child and used all the lanolin for weeks as I cried because of the pain of having cracked nipples. I can barely remember when they healed but it felt like forever. With my second child I purchased this before she was born and by the end of my first week breastfeeding her using this nipple butter I was no longer in pain even though I experienced the same cracks as I did with my son, they healed much faster. I still have plenty left over -if there is any concern that this is so expensive for such a small amount- it's more than enough!
customer_reviews.author: S c

customer_reviews.title: I wish the name was different
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't want anyone to see it on the vanity because of it's name... as for the quality- I really like how it moisterizes and heals dry skin just overnight and will keep using it. I didn't like the texture and smell though.
customer_reviews.author: DreaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: but this stuff just seems to work better. Like other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about a month now, exclusively breast feeding and on demand. I tried using the lanolin that the hospital offered, but this stuff just seems to work better. Like other reviewers, I noticed the little grains in it, but they disappear as you apply it. I wouldn't say my daughter was a natural breast feeder either, it took some practice for us to get it right. There were some blisters from her pulling off, but no chapping or cracks otherwise. I think it seriously saved my nipples. I would suggest this for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Danita Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. I used it after every feeding for months and did not have substantial issues with dryness or any cracking at all. My baby did have issues with latching (tongue tie), so I do think this helped keep the girls in good shape. It does have a slight scent, so I did not start using it for a couple days to make sure it didn't affect my baby learning my scent, but she's never seemed bothered by it at all, even if she's eaten shortly after an application.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: It smells like chocolate.
customer_reviews.text: After trying Earth mama’s diaper and perineal balm at the same time after I had my son i really liked this brand so when my nipples started cracking due to a bad latch I decided to get this butter.Now that everything is better I use it for my sons cheeks when they seem to get dry and I even use it as lip balm.
customer_reviews.author: Elvm

customer_reviews.title: Came to me opened... not good safe packaging
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this product after reading so many raving reviews. As I am getting ready for my delivery (in a week and half), I started putting together my hospital stuff. To my surprise, the container that this product came in was open already with what looked like a finger pressed into the center of the product. Since I have to apply this product during breast feeding period, I had to dump it becuase I’m not going to expose my to a suspicious opened Item. Very disappointed by the packaging. My husband bought me other products from this brand and now I’m paranoid. ;(
customer_reviews.author: AsburyNJ

customer_reviews.title: Does not come sealed
customer_reviews.text: Thick and moisturizing, but I’m not a fan of the fact that the product doesn’t come with a safety seal of any kind. Something intended for such an intimate area that will go in a baby’s mouth, should definitely be protected. It also looked kind of dry and cracked when I opened it. I’ve been using during pregnancy as I’ve been blessed with dry nipples... but I’ll be switching brands when the baby is born, just because of the seal thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not hard to spread
customer_reviews.text: We started out using lanolin at the hospital. Oh man...was I sore. The lanolin helps but it is uncomfortable to spread as it's very sticky. Also because it's sticky it makes sore nipples more sore when they rub anything. Tried this cream as soon as we got home....it's so much better! Very smooth application, no tugging. My nipples are still sore but that's to be expected. I can tell this cream is helping. It smells like cocoa.
customer_reviews.author: Jal11

customer_reviews.title: too expensive for what it is!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, read the ingredients and then look at your chapstick! I couldn't believe they were charging so much for this item when its literally the same as chapstick! It made me laugh and I returned it right away. I should have done my research before i bought the item but I didn't know any better. But hey, I'm honestly thinking about just having a tube of chapstick for my nips and calling it a day. I bet other moms out there have done the same thing! Don't buy this rip off! (unless your floating in money... but even then... buy something else!)
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Does not protect nipples!
customer_reviews.text: This didnt protect or heal my nipple at all and as a result it cracked and bled - ouch! It also caused for a brownish residue on my breast pads. While unharmful - was not pretty to look at. I'll stick to MotheraLove - since switching back I havent had any issues with my nipples bleeding!
customer_reviews.author: HobbyHobberson

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with stains on the box.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to getting this breastfeeding cream because of the great reviews. But upon arrival it had blue stains on the box. I don't know what the stains are from and I don't want to touch chemicals or any foreign substance. When I am breastfeeding baby so I had to throw it out. So I can't use the breastfeeding cream unfortunately. So this was a waste of money. I'm so disappointed I was looking forward to using it.
customer_reviews.author: Cori

customer_reviews.title: No seal
customer_reviews.text: When I received the product I opened the packaging which had no seals on it anywhere, it looked like there was an indent in it and it had droplets of water/moisture covering the whole top layer. This is a nipple butter. It’s supposed to be for use on an intimate area that’s also shared by the baby literally ingesting it. How is this allowed? How do I know if what I received was normal or whether something happened to it?
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: I actually love the product
customer_reviews.text: I actually love the product, but the one I got was either old or got chilled some how. It was lumpy with little beads of the oil in it instead of being smooth. I bought another from somewhere else that I use every day, but put this one in my diaper bag since I don't like using it and having to really rub out the beads.
customer_reviews.author: Tazia

customer_reviews.title: Motherlove > Earth Mama > Lanolin
customer_reviews.text: Pro: non GMO, volume, pricing. Con: no soothing feel, just moisturizing, has a truffle/chocolate smell. I have used up 2 bottles of Motherlove. Motherlove is more pricey so I have decided to try out Earth Mama for its good reviews, pricing and volume. But I guess you get what you paid for. Earth Mama is not bad, but comparing to Motherlove, I still prefer Motherlove more. I feel much much more soothing on my sore nipples after applying Motherlove, but not much on Earth Mama.
customer_reviews.author: Toejam

customer_reviews.text: I bought this for her girlfriend and she was 5 months pregnant. Her breasts were very dry and cracked so she wanted to try this product since she heard many great reviews. After using this product daily for a few weeks, it caused her breasts to worsen so she stopped using it. It could be that her body is allergic to a specific ingredient in this cream but ever since she stopped using it her breasts went back to normal. It doesn't hurt to try new products while your body is going through many changes. This cream didn't work for her pre-pregnancy but maybe she'll try to use it again when she starts breastfeeding and see what the outcome is.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a deep moisturizer on my knuckles, lips, hands and feet (not on nipples) and still love it. Occasionally will use on baby's wind burned cheeks. I've discovered its great for making my skin to be not-itchy after a mosquito or spider bite. I have referred this to many of my elderly clients to moisturize dry or allergic skin problems and thin skin. I love the natural ingredients and no preservatives. As others have said, its a bit crumbly on initial contact, but goes on smooth and crumbs melt from body heat. Needs re-application after few hours, but I am super happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Carty

customer_reviews.title: Better than Lansinoh lanolin cream
customer_reviews.text: This nipple cream has been a breastfeeding ESSENTIAL. I much prefer it to lanolin creams because I find lanolin is stickier and leaves weird stains on my shirts. This nipple cream is so soft and easy to spread. The color of the cream is green which I wasn't expecting, but it feels amazing. I use after feedings and BEFORE the shower (because water hitting sore nipples is not fun). Also, I found that putting this cream inside flanges makes pumping more comfortable. Other brands that contain lanolin are not ideal for pumping because they are stickier and cause friction.
customer_reviews.author: cp

customer_reviews.title: Itchy nipple relief!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not even breastfeeding yet - I’m 20 weeks pregnant but I’ve been using this product for weeks! It’s so helpful for those darn first/second trimester ITCHY NIPPLES!!! You know what I’m talking about ladies!.I’m hoping the itchiness doesn’t last into the third trimester... if it does... send help! But anyway - definitely buy the stuff. You won’t regret it! Also - it is pretty solid (reminds me of coconut oil the way it gets soft when you rub it) - I have to use the top of my fingernail to get enough out to spread around. People with super short nails might need a different tactic! lol
customer_reviews.author: Sclouser89

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love this, but it simply doesn't do the trick.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I was so sad this was such a disappointment. I was excited to have an all natural, non-lanolin balm, but wow do people use lanolin for good reason. It has a moisture barrier and heals raw, sore, even cracked nipples like freaking magic. This balm smells great and feels nice, but if you actually have raw nipples from nursing, you'll know that's simply not enough. I'm happy that I've since really looked into lanolin production (extraction) and I'm comfortable with the process. Not wanting to use animal products was the reason I looked for something like this, but no. Sorry Earth Mama! I've kept it for hand cream :)
customer_reviews.author: Linda E. Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: I like that this is a natural product but I don't ...
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is a natural product but I don't think it did anything for my nipples when I first started breastfeeding. I switched to lansinoh and felt like that made a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: HTTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Say Goodbye to Your Lanolin
customer_reviews.text: I used Lanolin at the hospital for all of two days... granting that's not the longest trial time, I can honestly say my nipples feel WORLDS better after applying Earth Mama than they did after applying Lanolin (from Lansinoh). I've been using this as someone who was breastfeeding a slightly tongue-tied baby for 12 days -- very painful!!! (we are now tongue-tie free, phew!!!) The cocoa butter makes this stuff feel and smell great. Pretty sure it's the only reason my nipples survived the tongue-tie. Highly recommend, especially if you're looking for an organic product that is safe for baby to ingest.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the best! Non-lanolin, non sticky, smooth cocoa butter scent. No residue or stains on my bras whatsoever. I love that it’s easy to spread and moisturizing without being too thin and oily like other products. I even use it on my chapped lips. I just bought my second jar, one for upstairs and one for down. I use it after each feeding and pumping session. Baby girl doesn’t notice the taste and it doesn’t irritate her mouth. Go with this one, I’m super happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Ericka Wade

customer_reviews.title: Very unhappy! Not sealed!!!!
customer_reviews.text: There is no seal on the box or the jar. The inside looked like it had been tampered with but that i guess that could be how it look. I can’t trust that this is safe for baby. Such a waste of money especially since it can’t be returned. I’m assuming it’s damaged. Is this is packaging is on purpose then that just should not be allowed with anything that could come in contact with a baby’s food source.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I tried, but just can't love it
customer_reviews.text: For the size/price, I really wanted to like it. I have been buying b...bease and knew I wanted lanolin free but a little more affordable. This is nicely moisturizing and works well for pumping. However, I just can't get past the smell; it's oddly coconut/medicinal, and not at all in a good way. It's also much harder to wash off than the b..bease and my little one seems to agree and will only latch if I completely wash it off. It may be more expensive, but back to the original product!
customer_reviews.author: Jules M

customer_reviews.title: Life (nipple) saver
customer_reviews.text: As someone allergic to lanolin I needed an alternative to the traditional creams. This stuff is amazing, love that it is baby safe so using it at any point and it being safe for baby is a huge plus. I have used it for the pump as well to make it a bit more comfortable. It doesn't smell amazing but who cares, no one is going to be smelling my nipples except for baby and the baby doesn't care at all.
customer_reviews.author: K. Post

customer_reviews.title: Don't like it.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know why this is highly rated. Out of all the nipple creams/pumping lubricants I've tried I hated this one the most. I think the smell turned me off (not a fan of cocoa butter smell). I also don't like the consistency of the product. It's quite hard and there is beady texture in it that breaks down with the warmth of your finger. I much prefer lubricants that are more soft in texture from the get go. It makes it much easier for a pumping mama like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Stuff, But Baby Dislikes
customer_reviews.text: This product seemed to be the perfect answer to the soreness in the beginning days of breastfeeding. It smells pleasant, is easy to apply (and open one handed which I’ve found to be a plus these days). It seemed to really be soothing when I used it. Unfortunately I won’t be continuing to use it because my baby absolutely refuses to eat after I’ve applied it - even after wiping it off. After a fussy night of poor latching I’m not going to try it again. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: HannahWI89

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried different creams and lanolin. I wasn’t excited about the side effects of lanolin, plus, I use reusable pads which can’t be washed with diapers if using lanolin. I didn’t expect much from this, since every other cream has let me down, but I was pleasantly surprised. It’s easy to spread, has been great keeping them moisturized. I haven’t had any cracking or bleeding, which is fantastic. Plus, I love that I don’t have to wipe it off before I feed my baby. Oh, and there isn’t a smell to it, which I appreciate. You also don’t see it through clothes, because some creams will leak through.
customer_reviews.author: GrammaTeacher

customer_reviews.title: It's nice, but not super emollient if you had very sore nipples
customer_reviews.text: I like this well enough. As a nipple cream, I honestly didn't find it super moisturising. It goes on very thin/lightweight. Thankfully this is my second nursling and I didn't really 'need' this as my nips didn't really get sore. If I had had the sore nipples I dealt with when I had my first baby, this cream would not have helped much. That said, it has been wonderful for using on baby's head to keep it moisturised as I'm clearing up her cradle cap! It's lightweight enough that it doesn't make her hair all sticky and greasy, and just moisturising enough that it's helping to keep the cradle cap at bay. It's nice on dry lips too.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Just do yourself a favor and buy this stuff before your baby even comes. Then you’ll be ready. It’s super moisturizing, made of natural ingredients that you don’t have to worry about the ingesting, and it doesn’t smell nasty! Totally saved my nipples. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: reximus

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Product not as pictured. Ive used this for a long time so I know how it usually looks and this one is not it. It’s clumpy and has hard nodules in it that don’t spread. The one I received has the old label on it so I’m assuming it’s an old product that’s been sitting around for a while. And of course it’s non-returnable so I paid for a product that I won’t even use because it looks like it’s gone bad. Buyers beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: CLHolland

customer_reviews.title: Great for multiple uses
customer_reviews.text: Like all the others say, this stuff works great, although I didn't need to use for my nipples. Thank goodness my nips never got bad enough where I needed to use it. I ended up using it for my lips initially. I figured if it's good for the skin of cracked nipples then surly it would work for my chapped lips, it did not disappoint. It actually worked better than my chapstick. Next I used it on my feet and then for any part of my skin that was dry. I even used it on my two month olds dry skin and mild cradle cap. A teeny tiny bit goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Jgonz84

customer_reviews.title: A necessity for breastfeeding a newborn!
customer_reviews.text: This saved me during breastfeeding especially the first 2 months that were the roughest. The hospital gave me lanolin but 1. I didn't like my baby ingesting a synthetic product. 2. I got desperate and it didn't help anyway. I tried Honest's nipple butter which I felt better about and it moisturized but I was still cracked and had to apply it constantly. Earth Mama I couldn't live without! It accrual restored my nipples on between feeds. I'm so thankful I had this during cluster feeding. It's also organic and my son didn't mind the taste but I would apply after a feed so it had time to absorb.
customer_reviews.author: Fair in colorado

customer_reviews.title: Must have for newborn!!
customer_reviews.text: Someone recommended this product to me and I’m so glad I got it! I put it in my hospital bag and it was a life savor! I’m a new mom and the few couple weeks of breastfeeding can be rough. I applied it after feeds and and especially at night. I like the ingredients and that it’s natural. It does leave a stain on shirts or bras so make sure it doesn’t get on your favorite shirt. It lasts a long time and I use it for more than just the nipples!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly hastie

customer_reviews.title: Heals fast!
customer_reviews.text: I believe that the fast healing is due to the high content of cocoa butter in this product. I had bruising and scabs from nursing my newborn and I applied this product after each nursing session. It only took a few days for me to be completely healed - no more bruising or scabs! My baby is now only 8 days old and I began using this product when he was 3 days old. I also use this on my lips and all over my baby’s body. It clears up all little newborn type marks on his body in just minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Multi use!
customer_reviews.text: So I originally bought this product for nursing purposes and it worked great. My daughter is now 18 months old and has some eczema around her little mouth on her face. She hasn’t nursed for months and months now but on a whim I tried using the left over nipple butter on her eczema after bath time and every single time we use it, she wakes up perfectly clear the following morning! It’s crazy. It seems a little oily on her face for the first bit, but it does wonders for irritated skin and I highly recommend it, not just for nursing purposes but for any dry or irritated baby skin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I have been incredibly impressed with this. Just a couple days in with kiddo #1, and I was already getting some cracks & bleeding. So painful. But once I started using this butter consistently (literally after every feeding, I first use milk, let that dry, and then use the butter next)...so much more comfortable. It was a little challenging to get out of the jar at first, but making sure my hands are fairly warm, and just taking my time have most definitely helped.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda L

customer_reviews.title: The best nipple cream ever
customer_reviews.text: I simply love this nipple butte. Besides using it for its purpose I started using it on my babies bottom to prevent any diaper rash. It works wonderfully. Just be sure to have two separate jars for each of the intended uses. It does say on the side of the jar that it can be used for other things too. Even on your hands to treat dry skin. It’s smells chocolaty and I love it! The ingredients are all safe if ingested, so not at all worried to use on nipples right before pumping to avoid blisters.
customer_reviews.author: alla

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Best nipple cream I ever use. I hadsomuch troble breasfeeding my first baby and the fact that thenipple creams I use were hardto apply and not actually helping me to heal didn't help at all. Thistime formy second kis, found this nipple cream and I love it. Easy to apply, runs smooth and helps healing in no time. You can actually feel the difference between feedings once you apply it.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Almache

customer_reviews.title: Looks like they improved the consistency
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought this stuff in October 2018, it had the little hard lumps in it that other people have mentioned. And yes, they were not enjoyable on sore nipples. But then I bought it again a few months later, and it was as smooth as could be--not a single lump to be found. Either my second tub was an anomaly, or they've improved their product based on feedback. Now it's perfect: soft on tender skin, still with the same faintly cocoa-y smell that I like and the natural ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ames

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has been a Godsend! I like this over Lansinoh. But in a pinch I’ll use the lansinoh or coconut oil if i don’t have this handy. This product helped tremendously during the beginning process of breastfeeding with cracked and bleeding nipples. It has shown to cause no tummy problems for my baby, it also doesn’t cause any kind of bumps on her face whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan P

customer_reviews.title: Grainy- Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I’m disappointed that the most recent orders I’ve placed have been very granular. There are small grainy bits which is less comfortable than the smooth product I received earlier this year. I’m not sure if the recipe has changed or what, but the product now has small particles.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Yadon

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth and gentle with skin
customer_reviews.text: I am 7.5 months pregnant. I've been using the Medela lanolin cream for nipples because I am trying out because I was recommended nipple creams for when the baby is breastfeeding. I was having a hard time spreading the cream over my nipples and it was doing more harm than good. I decided to give a try and by earth mama organics. I received it and opened it today. Definitely, the butter is much easier to spread than the lanolin cream. Medela product is thicker/denser whereas earth mama is smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, minus the smell
customer_reviews.text: The product works well and definitely was clutch as I started pumping; however, of all the Earth Mama Products this one is the anomaly- because of the smell. I absolutely love the smell of their perineal balm, and diaper cream, but not this. The nipple butter just smells off and the only other complaint I have is that you run through it quickly, but overall it definitely provides overnight relief.
customer_reviews.author: h. minkler

customer_reviews.title: Organic is best
customer_reviews.text: I literally only needed this the first week or two and then very rarely after. I only use it when I pump to add the lubrication. It's going to last a long time and it's super quality. You don't even have to wash it off because it's organic and all natural !!! I was so shocked in the hospital the lanolin crap they say wipe it off before feeding ok but the label says Cal poison control in case of accidental ingestion. For newborn? Wow so scary. going with safe for baby 100% of the time
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Arrived without a safety seal
customer_reviews.text: My product arrived without a safety seal. Other Earth Mama products I have purchased from other retailers came with a safety seal. I was excited to try this balm, but I won’t be using it because my baby could end up ingesting some of it and I’m afraid it could be contaminated or old or who knows what. This product can not be returned so I’m pretty disappointed
customer_reviews.author: K & J

customer_reviews.title: Nice, wish it were easier to spread
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been using it with breastfeeding yet, but I have some early leakage issues and this stuff helps immensely as I end up getting some build up and it irritates my nipples, but once I put a little bit of this on they don't hurt as much. I do wish it were a creamier or thinner consistency, I have to warm it up between my fingers normally in order to spread it properly, but aside from that I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: It puts the /butter/ on the skin...
customer_reviews.text: Seriously love this product. My NB daughter has an insane latch and it can often lead to severely painful “chi-chi leches” as my hubby and I call them. This product is easy to spread, and pretty on par with the Medela nipple ointment minus the lanolin if I remember correctly. You don’t need to worry about wiping/washing it off before nursing again, so it’s less hassle when it comes to that (win!)
customer_reviews.author: Rachel S.

customer_reviews.title: Necessity for breastfeeding moms!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST! I tried the lanolin nipple cream and it did nothing but make my baby's face greasy. This is amazing. Anyone who is even thinking of breastfeeding need to bring this with them to the hospital and start using it on day 1. It'll make such a difference. I use it also when I pump and it can also be used as a lip balm. It's my go to gift along with some version of the gel breastfeeding pads for expecting mothers.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: As a first-time mother who's still working out the kinks of breastfeeding, this product is genuinely a lifesaver! Within just a few feeds, my nipples were horribly cracked and bruised, and feeding was painful. The nipple cream given to me at the hospital had lanolin in it. Even if I cleansed my nipple (and I was pretty good about not applying that cream close to when my baby would feed), my baby could still taste it and he would end up fussing. This Earth Mama Nipple Butter, on the other hand, doesn't have that same problem. My baby is eating like a champ, and it's no longer painful for me to feed him! It's very soothing for the nipples too.
customer_reviews.author: zyxian

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have For Nursing Moms
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my favorite nursing product. It's a must-have. I tried a few different balms, including straight up coconut oil, but this is the winner. The ingredients are great so I don't have to worry about washing my nipples before nursing (I still wipe off the excess but the jar says you don't have to) and it really makes a big difference with cracked/dry nipples. I also noticed my baby seemed annoyed by the smell or taste of the coconut oil but has no problem with this. I also use this on my lips. I'll definitely be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Winter

customer_reviews.title: Leaves grease stains and doesn't heal the nipple
customer_reviews.text: A little greasy and doesn't really heal the nipple like I thought it would. I still have cracked and dry nipples from feeding. The product is pretty stinky too. So not my favorite but it is moisturizing when you put it on. It's the same consistency of lip balm. I would suggest wearing nursing pads to avoid grease stains on your shirt.
customer_reviews.author: sara3737

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is LEGIT!
customer_reviews.text: After reading so many great reviews and blogs recommending this stuff, I had to get it. My daughter was born in January, it was super cold out, and we were working through some latch issues. My nipples were basically hamburger meat. This stuff really helped ease the pain and heal my nipples. Better than anything else I have used in the past (this was my third nursling- I’ve tried it all!). It’s also great for chapped lips, dry elbows, and cuticles. I do a lot of housework and my nails are wrecked. I just put it on before bed and it helps with dry cuticles and bad hangnails. Also works great for baby’s skin.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: I have 3 of these around my house!
customer_reviews.text: I have found that this is my favorite option to use after nursing and as such now have 3 different containers so I don't end up with one that I have to try to remember where it is. This definitely has a bit of a tint that colors my reusable nursing pads but it seems to wash out just fine. I like that it seems to soak into my skin more than lanolin which sits on top. At first my LO didn't seem to love whatever slight taste this left, but she's gotten over that now.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Calson

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is not sticky at all, everything is natural and it feels safe as it will be in my babys mouth. It smells faintly sweet. I also use it on my lips lol! This and hydrogel pads cure my chapped nippys within a couple days or so! It does get clumpy from the beeswax but you just have to warm it in your fingers before applying!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: recommended by a lactation nurse
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to my daughter by a lactation nurse. My daughter was having trouble getting through the initial soreness from nursing and this nipple butter was a God-send!! The baby is now 7 months old, and my daughter still uses this product religiously!! Don't give up...try everything to get through the tough days...try this!!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Lee

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, effective product!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute life saver in the hospital and for postpartum. I used this for baby's dry patches, my lips chapped from hospital stay, and of course my nips healed and feel comforted before, during and after breastfeeding. Super pleased with this product. Even if I forget to wipe it off before feeding, baby doesnt mind. Spreads so easy but not too greasy more does it stain my bras. Will continue to buy even after breastfeeding for other purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Throw out the lanolin
customer_reviews.text: Hate the smell and consistency of lanolin so thought I would try this on my third baby. Perfect relief, also have used for dry knuckles from all the hand washing, as a lip moisturizer, even on baby bum. This little pot goes a long way. Not weird and sticky, smells similar to cocoa butter, mild pleasant taste ( since baby will be tasting it, it's worth considering.) A little gritty in the pot but melts with body temp. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ashe

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love Earth Mama products. They are just what you need. They do their job without all the chemicals like the other guys. Love all the products I've ever got from them. The stuff feels good. This product remains a solid until you start to spread it. It starts to soften in the container as soon as I touch it, as soon as there is enough softened and on my finger I can use it. Not messy, easy to clean. Smells amazing and my baby doesn't mind it at all.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: life saver
customer_reviews.text: This really helped during the first couple weeks of breastfeeding. I like that the ingredients were clean and it was safe for baby - didnt need to wash it off before feeding baby. I applied it on my nipple area after each feeding and that helped a lot with the pain. I'd add this to any care package for new mommies.
customer_reviews.author: min2be

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use something organic this time around and decided to give this a shot. When it came in the mail I was a little disappointed in it's size. However, that quickly vanished. A little bit goes a long way and it actually works!!! I like that it's thick enough to provide protection, but not so thick you have trouble applying it like some creams. Also it doesn't stain and you can use it right before and after feedings... The best part about this cream is that it helps heal crack/sore nipples. Other creams seem to just act as lubricants but don't actually speed up the healing process.
customer_reviews.author: El uno

customer_reviews.title: RECOMMEND 💯
customer_reviews.text: Omg!!! I 1,000 times recommend! Since breastfeeding for me is new, my nipples were very damaged and super sensitive! I thought I would never find anything to make them feel better until I found this. Let me tell you!! They healed so well. I would apply it after feeding and it was like I didn’t even feed. They have to put some sort of magic in there bc it works wonders! 100% yes!
customer_reviews.author: Pauline McGarry

customer_reviews.title: This is not a healer only moisturizer
customer_reviews.text: This stuff you have to constantly apply. It is very soothing though. My baby had a reaction to it though when ingested. Even though I’ve read that you do not have to wipe it off before feeding. It does not heal the situation it only has temporary relief. I’ve used it For a week exactly and I’ll continue until it’s gone. Worked better on my cracked lips.
customer_reviews.author: Ja'Nay Rhine

customer_reviews.title: Better than Lanolin!
customer_reviews.text: This is way better than the lansinoh lanolin cream. My nipples were constantly red and super sore even with air drying, lanolin, and changing breast pads frequently. This nipple butter has saved my nipples and makes them feel so much better!! I immediately rub some on after nursing and am able to put it in my bra right away again. So satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Drew Chatterton

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I struggled with really sore nipples my first few weeks of breastfeeding. I tried two other popular nipple cream brands and finally ordered this Earth Mama cream. Boy do I wish I would have just started with this cream. I felt relief in just a couple of days after use. Don't hesitate, just buy it. It's worth a shot if you have sore nips.
customer_reviews.author: Kylee

customer_reviews.title: Breastfeeding No Brainer, This Balm is the One
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is so amazing that after my first few days of breastfeeding (which any new mom knows can be very painful and uncomfortable) one application COMPLETELY relieved the discomfort and chaffing and it has never come back. This is a breastfeeding no brainer. Don’t even let your tired brain overthink different balms. For breastfeeding, this is the one. Got it because I love the ingredients. Smells good, goes on smooth, not sticky, and no need to wash off before feeding. Put extra on your fingernails and lips, too!
customer_reviews.author: Quite Nicely

customer_reviews.title: Small but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This has replaced my belly oil since my skin has itched from my growing belly. Prevents nipple chafing and smells like cocoa/ chocolate. Sometimes I put it on my lips. It came very smooth and not bubbly like some got. My organic shea butter did that and you have to melt it down and pour it back into the container. I didn’t have to with this.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Anderson

customer_reviews.title: A must have for sore nipples!
customer_reviews.text: I love this butter! When I delivered my baby the nurses gave me sample packs of this butter at the hospital and it's the only thing that gave me relief after nursing. I had bought the lansinoh organic nipple balm, but it doesn't work as well. Mama's also smells really good and you don't need to wash it off before breast feeding. I will say that with my sample packs it has more of a gritty texture, and with the jar it comes out smoother, but it takes a while to loosen it in the jar. Overall, I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Must have for breast feeding mamas
customer_reviews.text: This butter has helped me tremendously. I apply it nightly to help any dryness and keep it at bay and the moisturizing quality is lovely. As a new mom of a 4-month old, I like that I’ve added the nbutter to my nightly ritual for bed - 1) face lotion 2) butter 3) body lotion 4) eye lotion 6) brush hair 7) bed. 😴 Makes a good gift for any new mama care packages or as a shower gift.
customer_reviews.author: dloz9

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could give more stars!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was by far one of my favorite products postpartum. I HIGHLY recommend if you plan on breastfeeding. At first it was painful to feed but I was determined to keep going. This was a life saver. It has safe ingredients for your baby to ingest, this is important because you don’t want to wash and dry your already irritated nipples every time you feed your baby. This way you can leave it on promoting healing and relief. Definitely buy this and recommend to everyone you know!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Granular bits
customer_reviews.text: I had received some organic mama nipple butter at my baby shower and I really liked it. I ordered more and the container I received is very granular. The hard bits will melt and I’m still able to use it, but I wish it was just smooth throughout, would save a lot of hassle. Other than that it’s okay, smells nice and has a good consistency once the granular bits have melted.
customer_reviews.author: Alaina Mann

customer_reviews.title: Like Magic
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what kind of black magic is in this stuff but it really works. It is a life saver. It soothes sore nipples and prevents cracking and sores. If I don't use it after everytime I nurse I regret it. It is easy to spread on and the baby doesn't mind the taste, if there is any. I also use the leftovers on my finger as chapstick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great investment for your nipps
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product!! I would order it again and again. My nipples were getting really damaged due to a latching problem. This definitely helped soothe and heal them. I'm a nursing mom and have been using this product since day one. *Update my nipples got really cracked and this product did not help soothe or heal
customer_reviews.author: AEspii

customer_reviews.title: It has a wonderful cocoa smell and I will update after baby is ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before the birth of my baby because the price dipped and I've had it on my registry from the beginning. customer_reviews.author: Jodie

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing

This cream + air drying for a few days took care of some severe bleeding and a puss spot! Traditional lanolin brands are too rough on extremely sore nipple. * Also read about the pesticides in lanolin products so this product is a better alternative
customer_reviews.author: NM

customer_reviews.title: No more blocked ducts
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 40 something non-breast-feeding mother who kept getting clogged ducks. Ever since I’ve been using this I have not had any. Don’t know if it’s a coincidence but I’m not going to stop and try to find out. Easily spreadable, but after some time the beads seem a little harder to smooth out
customer_reviews.author: JBCMom

customer_reviews.title: Very smoothing
customer_reviews.text: I'm still pregnant and had issues with the dryness of nipples. It really helped me a lot. Very recommmend
customer_reviews.author: diana radzikhovska

customer_reviews.title: Best lip balm!

I would apply to my nipples before pumping and never had any pain or discomfort. I had purchased a few of these in advance but decided to wean earlier than I had previously planned. I went thru 1 jar when pumping, gifted one to a pregnant friend, and kept one to use as lip balm. It’s so good, I’ll probably keep buying this just for that reason, it’s so moisturizing and comfortable. Will also use with any future babies I nurse/pump for!
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Soothed & Moisturized

The first week was really the only painful part but Earth Mama's nipple butter got me through it! It was soothing, moisturized sufficiently and absorbed well into the skin well so there wasn't excess left by the time the baby latched again. Would highly recommend for Moms who wish to breastfeed!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: just OK

I had the motherlove brand before this and I preferred it, but wanted to try this brand because I love all the other things they com out with. So it works but overall, I didn't love it.
customer_reviews.author: Rita M.

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: What a lifesaver during the early days of breastfeeding. As a new mom, I didn’t fully know what to expect and within the first day I was hesitant to nurse because the pain. This helped my scabs and bruises to heal quickly and prevent dryness and cracking. It does leave some residue behind on the fabric but it can be removed if treated before washing. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I am exclusively pumping and it does a good job of keeping my nipples moist. My only issue is that the product does not come sealed in any way. You just twist the top off and start using it. So how do I know it hasn’t been tampered with? For a topical product, I would definitely prefer that it come sealed.
customer_reviews.author: Ray M

customer_reviews.title: Love the smell of this
customer_reviews.text: Love the smell of this, it almost smells like chocolate to me as weird as that sounds. Only reason I don’t want to give 5 stars is because sometimes the texture could get almost a bit grainy, kind of like how honey gets a bit gritty at times and it could be slightly uncomfortable to apply right after I pumped. Otherwise, nice product, maybe could be a bit softer/slicker/less thick of a solution so it was easier to apply
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.author: Izza

Woke up within an hour they were healing the right away effect was that it just cooled them down and gave relief! I recommend to anyone who is breast feed!

customer_reviews.title: Good product

customer_reviews.title: Love it

customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best nipple cream/butter I’ve tried

customer_reviews.author: Spangler

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I started using this immediately after my daughter was born. My nipples were a little sore, but kept applying every time after breast feeding and experienced NO chapped nipples or bleeding. After 4 days my nipples were no longer sore and I still occasionally used 2 weeks PP just for extra moisture. Love this product and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth m

customer_reviews.title: Awesome

I cloth diaper my son and in a Mom group on fb it was suggested as a cloth safe diaper balm so i was happy to get multiple uses and none was wasted!

customer_reviews.author: Quincey Austell

customer_reviews.title: Works like healing magic ❤
customer_reviews.text: I tried the Lansinoh lanolin cream in my 1st pregnancy which was good. With my 2nd one, I decided to give a try the Earth Mama Nipple Cream as I read about it on a blog. (I'm just reviewing as Mother, not sponsored by anyone)
customer_reviews.author: Raha

customer_reviews.title: So great, I wrote a review.....
customer_reviews.text: I am on day 4 of breastfeeding and was using the Medela samples from hospital. I was literally cringing for 2 minutes after baby’s latch because of the soreness and pain. My entire body was tense. I opened this today and put it on 2-3 minutes before feeding my child. At the time of application, my nipples were sore to the touch. I let her latch and WOW I almost didn’t feel it. I didn’t expect such immediate relief. The butter immediately soothed cracked and sore nipples. I also realized that the butter was so smooth that it allowed for a smoother latch vs the previous friction. I highly recommend and I look forward to continued use.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta T.

I had thrush a few months into breastfeeding and this helped soothe my poor nipple wonderfully! customer_reviews.author: Margaret Bayer

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product while breastfeeding all three of my babies, and it really works. Soothing and moisturizing. customer_reviews.author: MCC

customer_reviews.text: This is by far my favorite for dry nipples. It’s winter and I live in Colorado so my skin is super dry. I’ve used this for my chapped lips too. Love it and baby doesn’t mind it.

customer_reviews.title: Completely sold on this product!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I loved this the moment I opened it. It smells lovely and goes on so smoothly. It’s got the texture of a balm. I love that the ingredients are so good so I don’t worry about nursing soon after I’ve applied this. I use this after every feeding. Great product!
